tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div figure div div div div div div h2 span
html body div div div div div div div div div div figure figcaption span
html body div div div div div div div div div div figure figcaption span
html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: Rod Rosenstein, the US deputy attorney general, is set for crunch talks with Donald Trump on Thursday, amid doubts over his future in the job.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: The two already spoke on Monday to discuss reports that Mr Rosenstein had talked last year about ousting the president and secretly taping him.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: Mr Rosenstein oversees the inquiry into alleged collusion by the Trump team with Russia during the 2016 election.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: The president said Thursday's meeting would be "determining what's going on".

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: "We want to have transparency, we want to have openness and I look forward to meeting with Rod at that time," he added, speaking in New York where he is attending the annual UN General Assembly.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div figure span span
html body div div div div div div div div div div figure span span
html body div div div div div div div div div div figure figcaption span
html body div div div div div div div div div div figure figcaption span
content: Chief of Staff John Kelly (left) and Assistant Attorney General Rod Rosenstein (right) had a previously scheduled meeting at the White House on Monday

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div h2 span
html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: America's second most senior law official was summoned to the White House on Monday amid

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p a span
content: a report that he had verbally resigned

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: to the president's chief of staff in the expectation that he was going to be fired.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: But White House press secretary Sarah Sanders said afterwards: "At the request of the Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein, he and President Trump had an extended conversation to discuss the recent news stories.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: "Because the President is at the United Nations General Assembly and has a full schedule with leaders from around the world, they will meet on Thursday when the President returns to Washington DC."

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: Monday's meeting between Chief of Staff John Kelly and Mr Rosenstein had been previously scheduled, US media later reported.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div h2 span
html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: If Mr Rosenstein did lose his job, another Department of Justice official, the solicitor general, would be in line to take over supervision of the Russia investigation.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: Mr Rosenstein assumed oversight of the inquiry after his boss, Attorney General Jeff Sessions, recused himself when it emerged he had been in contact with Russia's ambassador to Washington while serving as a Trump campaign adviser.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: The furore around Mr Rosenstein's position comes as mid-term elections are looming on 6 November, when the president's party will try to keep control of the US Congress.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div figure div div span
content: Media playback is unsupported on your device

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div figure div div div div div div h2 span
content: The 25th Amendment: Could it be used to unseat Trump?

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div figure figcaption span
html body div div div div div div div div div div figure figcaption span
content: The 25th Amendment: Could it be used to unseat Trump?

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div h2 span
content: What did the report on Rosenstein say?

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: Mr Rosenstein and Mr Trump are believed to have discussed Friday's report in the New York Times that the deputy attorney general had discussed recruiting cabinet members to invoke a US constitutional clause that provides for the removal of a president if deemed unfit for office.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: According to the newspaper, Mr Rosenstein had also suggested surreptitiously recording the president in order to expose the chaos in the White House.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: He denied the claims, and a Department of Justice spokesperson told the BBC the secret recording remark was just a joke.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: The deputy attorney general was said to have made the comments after Mr Trump fired FBI Director James Comey in May 2017.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div h2 span
content: Without Rosenstein, Russia inquiry in doubt

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p strong span
content: Analysis by Anthony Zurcher, BBC Washington

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: If Rod Rosenstein goes, by resignation or firing, the future of Robert Mueller's special counsel investigation would be very much in doubt.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: Mr Rosenstein is the reason there is a special counsel investigation, and he has given Mr Mueller a wide mandate to pursue that inquiry wherever it may lead.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: It has resulted, for instance, in the successful prosecution of former Trump campaign chair Paul Manafort and a plea deal from Donald Trump's personal lawyer Michael Cohen - both for activities tangential to the Russia probe.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: A different person in charge might have nipped those moves in the bud.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: Whoever took over if Mr Rosenstein departed - at the moment, Solicitor General Noel Francisco - could decide to curtail the scope of the investigation or push for a speedy resolution.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: At the very least, Mr Francisco would assume the oversight duties knowing full well the president is watching very closely and has no hesitation going on the attack - even against members of his own administration - if he feels in any way slighted or wronged.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: As Mr Rosenstein will surely attest, it is an unenviable position.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div figure span span
html body div div div div div div div div div div figure span span
html body div div div div div div div div div div figure figcaption span
html body div div div div div div div div div div figure figcaption span
content: From left: Mr Rosenstein, Attorney General Jeff Sessions, and Mr McCabe

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div h2 span
html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: Mr Trump said over the weekend he had not made up his mind whether to fire the deputy attorney general in the wake of the New York Times report.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: "We will make a determination," the Republican president told Fox News in the radio interview, which aired on Monday. "It's certainly a very sad story.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: "I haven't gotten all the facts, but certainly it's being looked at in terms of what took place - If anything took place."

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div ul li a span
html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: Sean Hannity, a Fox News host and friend of Mr Trump, has urged him to not fire Mr Rosenstein, warning he would fall into a trap laid by his political enemies.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: Mr Trump has repeatedly referred to the special counsel's Russia investigation as a political witch hunt.

tag: html body div div div div div div div div div div p span
content: Andrew McCabe, the former acting director of the FBI who was fired by Mr Trump in March, said on Monday that he was "deeply concerned" about rumours of Mr Rosenstein's departure as it would put the Russia investigation "at risk".
